metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10732 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's implementation of Userspace core dumps. This flaw allows an attacker with a local account to crash a trivial program and exfiltrate private kernel data. It was discovered that the elf handling code in the Linux kernel did not initialize memory before using it in certain situations. A local attacker could use this to possibly expose sensitive information (kernel memory).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10732` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-115-generic - 4.15.0-115.116
linux-image-4.15.0-115-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-115.116
linux-image-4.15.0-115-lowlatency - 4.15.0-115.116
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-115-generic - 4.15.0-115.116
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-115-lowlatency - 4.15.0-115.116
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: sbeattie> original report claimed this was introduced in 4206d3aa1978e44f58bfa4e1c9d8d35cbf19c187, but further investigation by Jann Horn makes the case that 91c3dba7dbc1 is where the real problem is introduced.

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-115.116').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1080.84').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
